definitions: kept ready for immediate use or deployment when needed
serving as a substitute or backup when the primary option fails
examples: The standby generator kicked in during the power outage
We keep standby equipment in case of emergencies
The standby pilot replaced the sick crew member
There's always a standby team ready to respond

definitions: in an upright position rather than sitting or lying down
permanently established and continuing without change or interruption over time
relating to one's position or status in society or a profession
examples: The standing passengers held onto the rails tightly
There was only standing room left in the theater
They have a standing appointment every Tuesday morning
The company has standing orders with several suppliers
Her standing in the community improved after the donation
The team's standing in the league dropped significantly

definitions: forming an essential or basic part of something regularly used or consumed
constituting the main or most important element of something
examples: Rice is a staple food in many Asian countries
Cotton became the staple crop of the region
Tourism is the staple industry of the island nation
These topics are staple subjects in elementary education

definitions: featuring or relating to a famous performer or celebrity as the main attraction
being exceptionally good or outstanding in performance or quality
examples: The star player scored three goals in the match
She got the star role in the new Broadway show
He was the star student in his graduating class
This is our star product this quarter

definitions: relating to or located on the right side of a ship or aircraft when facing forward
examples: The starboard engine failed during the flight
Turn to starboard to avoid the rocks ahead
The starboard cabin has a better ocean view
We saw dolphins off the starboard bow yesterday

definitions: containing a lot of starch or having the texture of starch
excessively formal and stiff in manner or behavior
examples: Potatoes and rice are starchy foods
The starchy texture made the sauce too thick
Her starchy manner made everyone feel uncomfortable
The headmaster gave a starchy speech at graduation

definitions: looking fixedly at something with eyes wide open
extremely obvious or conspicuous in an unpleasant way
examples: The staring eyes in the portrait seemed to follow her
He sat with staring eyes after hearing the news
The staring mistake in the report embarrassed everyone
There was a staring gap in their security system

definitions: severe or bare in appearance with no decoration or ornamentation
complete and absolute without any qualification or mitigation
unpleasantly harsh and impossible to avoid or deny
examples: The stark landscape stretched endlessly before them
The room had stark white walls and minimal furniture
She faced the stark choice between career and family
The report painted a stark picture of poverty
The stark reality hit them when the bills arrived
There's a stark contrast between rich and poor here

definitions: marked or decorated with stars or star-shaped symbols
featured as a main performer in a show or production
examples: The starred items on the menu are chef's specials
She reviewed the starred messages in her inbox
The starred cast included several Academy Award winners
He starred in three Broadway shows last year

definitions: featuring someone as the main performer or in the leading role
examples: The starring role went to an unknown actress
This is his first starring performance on Broadway
She had a starring position in the company's growth
The product played a starring role in their success

definitions: filled with or illuminated by stars in the sky
having a pattern or appearance that resembles stars
unrealistically idealistic or dreamy in one's hopes or ambitions
examples: They walked hand in hand under the starry sky
It was a clear starry night perfect for astronomy
She wore a dress with a starry pattern
The starry decorations lit up the entire room
His starry dreams of fame never materialized
She had starry visions of her future career

definitions: marking or relating to the beginning or first part of something
used or positioned at the beginning of a race or competition
examples: The starting salary for this position is competitive
What's your starting point for the negotiations?
All runners must be at the starting line
The starting gun fired and the race began

definitions: feeling or showing sudden surprise or alarm, typically from something unexpected
examples: Her startled expression showed she hadn't expected visitors
The startled deer ran into the forest
He gave a startled cry when the door slammed
She looked startled by the sudden question

definitions: causing sudden surprise or wonder because of being unexpected or remarkable
examples: The startling discovery changed their understanding completely
She made a startling announcement at the meeting
The resemblance between them was startling
He showed startling improvement in just one month

definitions: suffering or dying from lack of food and extreme hunger
severely lacking or deprived of something needed or desired
examples: The starved prisoners were finally given food
Rescue workers found starved animals in the abandoned house
The plants looked starved of sunlight and water
She felt emotionally starved in the relationship

definitions: feeling extremely hungry though not necessarily in danger
suffering severely or dying from lack of food
examples: I'm starving after missing breakfast and lunch
The starving students raided the cafeteria
The charity helps starving children in war zones
Starving populations need immediate humanitarian aid

definitions: formally declared or expressed in clear and definite terms
specified or fixed according to formal agreement or rules
examples: The stated goal was to reduce emissions by half
She ignored the stated policy on overtime work
We must arrive at the stated time
The stated price doesn't include taxes

definitions: not recognized as a citizen of any country and lacking nationality
examples: Stateless persons often struggle to access basic services
The refugee became stateless after fleeing her country
Millions of stateless people live without legal protection
The stateless population faces numerous daily challenges

definitions: having a dignified, impressive, and graceful appearance or manner
examples: The stately mansion overlooked the manicured gardens
She walked with stately grace down the aisle
The ceremony proceeded at a stately pace
The stately oak trees lined the driveway

definitions: extending throughout or relating to an entire state within a country
examples: The statewide election will be held next Tuesday
They launched a statewide campaign against drunk driving
The statewide shortage of teachers affects rural areas most
This statewide policy applies to all public schools

definitions: lacking movement, action, or change, especially in a dull way
relating to electrical charges that accumulate rather than flow as current
examples: Sales remained static despite the marketing campaign
The static economy worried government officials
Static electricity made her hair stand on end
The static charge damaged the computer components

definitions: not moving or intended to be moved from a fixed position
examples: The car remained stationary at the traffic light
Please remain stationary during the X-ray
The stationary bike provides excellent cardio exercise
They installed stationary security cameras

definitions: relating to the collection, analysis, and interpretation of numerical data
examples: The statistical analysis revealed surprising patterns
We need more statistical evidence before deciding
Statistical methods help predict market trends
The statistical probability of success is very high

definitions: relating to or suitable for statues or the art of making statues
examples: The museum's statuary collection includes ancient Greek works
She studied statuary art in Florence
The statuary marble was imported from Italy
Statuary bronze is the preferred medium for monuments

definitions: established, regulated, or required by statute or formal written law
examples: The statute law differs from common law precedents
They exceeded the statute limitations for filing claims
Statute books contain all the written laws
This falls under statute regulations

definitions: required, permitted, or enacted by statute or formal written law
examples: Employers must provide statutory sick pay
The statutory retirement age has been raised
She took her full statutory maternity leave
The company met all statutory requirements

definitions: very loyal and committed in attitude, belief, or support
examples: She remained a staunch supporter throughout the scandal
He's a staunch believer in free speech
Their staunch opposition prevented the merger
The staunch allies stood together

definitions: resolutely or dutifully firm and unwavering in purpose or loyalty
examples: Her steadfast determination helped her overcome all obstacles
He remained steadfast in his beliefs
Their steadfast support never wavered during hard times
She showed steadfast loyalty to her principles

definitions: firmly fixed, stable, or securely positioned without shaking or wobbling
developing or continuing gradually at a regular and even pace
sensible, reliable, and self-restrained in character or behavior
examples: Keep the camera steady while taking the photo
She needed steady hands for the delicate surgery
The company showed steady growth over five years
He maintained a steady pace throughout the marathon
She's a steady influence on the younger students
You need steady nerves for this job

definitions: behaving or done in a cautious and secretive manner to avoid detection
examples: The cat made stealthy movements toward the bird
They heard stealthy footsteps in the hallway
The stealthy approach allowed them to surprise the enemy
She took stealthy glances at her phone during class

definitions: cooked by the heat of steam rather than by boiling or frying
very angry or upset about something
examples: The steamed vegetables retained their nutrients
She ordered steamed dumplings from the menu
He was really steamed about the parking ticket
She got steamed when they canceled her reservation

definitions: giving off steam or vapor from heat or moisture
very hot, especially uncomfortably so
extremely angry or furious
examples: The steaming coffee warmed her cold hands
A steaming bowl of soup arrived at the table
It was a steaming hot day in August
The steaming jungle air was hard to breathe
She was steaming mad about the unfair decision
He left the meeting absolutely steaming

definitions: hot and humid with visible moisture or steam in the air
sexually exciting or suggestive in content or atmosphere
examples: The steamy bathroom mirror fogged up completely
It was a steamy afternoon in the rainforest
The novel contained several steamy love scenes
They shared a steamy kiss in the rain

definitions: resembling steel in color, brightness, or hardness
showing cold determination or extreme strength of purpose
examples: His steely gray eyes never showed emotion
The steely surface reflected the harsh light
She fixed him with a steely gaze
His steely determination impressed everyone

definitions: rising or falling sharply at a very sharp angle almost perpendicular
unreasonably high or excessive in amount or price
examples: The steep mountain path challenged even experienced hikers
She carefully descended the steep stairs
The restaurant charges steep prices for ordinary food
That's a steep increase in rent this year

definitions: capable of being directed or controlled in movement or direction
examples: The steerable parachute allowed precise landing control
This model has steerable front wheels
The steerable antenna can track multiple satellites
They developed a steerable laser system

definitions: relating to stars or consisting of stars in astronomy
exceptionally good or outstanding in quality or performance
examples: The stellar constellation was visible all night
Scientists study stellar evolution using powerful telescopes
She gave a stellar performance in the lead role
The team's stellar season ended with a championship

definitions: having a stem or stalk of a specified kind or length
examples: The long-stemmed roses looked elegant in the vase
She arranged the stemmed glasses on the shelf
The stemmed mushrooms were carefully cleaned
These stemmed cherries are perfect for cocktails

definitions: proceeding or changing by steps or discrete stages rather than continuously
examples: The stepwise approach made the complex problem manageable
They used stepwise regression in their analysis
The stepwise increase in difficulty helped students learn
Evolution often occurs through stepwise changes

definitions: using or relating to sound reproduction using two or more channels
examples: The stereo system filled the room with music
She prefers stereo headphones for better sound
The stereo recording captured the concert perfectly
This stereo equipment is top quality

definitions: relating to sound reproduction using two separate audio channels to create spatial effect
examples: The stereophonic recording made listeners feel present
They upgraded to stereophonic sound equipment
Stereophonic broadcasts became standard in the 1960s
The stereophonic effect was remarkably realistic

definitions: relating to or denoting a process by which two images create three-dimensional effect
examples: The stereoscopic display created realistic depth perception
Surgeons use stereoscopic microscopes for precision
Stereoscopic photography was popular in Victorian times
The stereoscopic vision helps judge distances accurately

definitions: conforming to a fixed or general pattern lacking individuality
repeatedly following the same pattern without variation or originality
examples: The movie featured stereotyped characters without depth
She rejected the stereotyped role of housewife
His stereotyped responses showed no real thought
The stereotyped behavior suggests an underlying condition

definitions: relating to or characterized by a widely held but oversimplified image or idea
examples: He defied stereotypical expectations about his profession
The advertisement used stereotypical gender roles
That's a stereotypical response from management
She avoided stereotypical tourist destinations

definitions: completely free from bacteria or other living microorganisms
unable to produce children or offspring through biological reproduction
lacking in imagination, creativity, or excitement
examples: The sterile surgical instruments were carefully prepared
They work in a sterile laboratory environment
The accident left him sterile and unable to father children
Many hybrid plants are sterile
The sterile atmosphere of the office stifled creativity
Their sterile conversation lacked any real connection

definitions: made completely clean and free from bacteria or other microorganisms
examples: The sterilized bottles are safe for baby formula
All equipment must be properly sterilized
The sterilized water was used for the procedure
Sterilized soil prevents plant diseases

definitions: made of silver that is at least 92.5 percent pure
excellent or valuable in quality or character
examples: The sterling silver cutlery was a wedding gift
She wore her grandmother's sterling jewelry
His sterling reputation opened many doors
She has a sterling academic record

definitions: demanding strict attention to rules and behavior without compromise
having a serious and unfriendly manner that suggests disapproval
examples: The stern teacher tolerated no disruptions
She gave him a stern warning about his behavior
His stern expression silenced the room
The judge's stern face showed no sympathy

definitions: relating to or containing steroids or steroid compounds
examples: The doctor prescribed steroidal medication for inflammation
Steroidal hormones regulate many body functions
She avoided steroidal treatments due to side effects
The steroidal compound showed promising results

definitions: cooked slowly in liquid at a temperature just below boiling point
drunk or intoxicated from consuming too much alcohol
examples: The stewed beef was tender and flavorful
She served stewed tomatoes with the meal
He got completely stewed at the office party
They were pretty stewed by midnight
